TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ScrollEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Scroll` event occurs when the user changes the value of the scroll bar. This event can result from a variety of actions, such as clicking a scroll bar arrow, pressing the UP ARROW or DOWN ARROW, or dragging the scroll box. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs> specifies the type of scroll event that occurred and the new value of the scroll bar. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation%2A> property to determine the scroll bar orientation for the `Scroll` event.
The `Scroll` event occurs for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> controls.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member.
[!code-cpp[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ScrollBar.OnScroll Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=nameWithType> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl>. Then name the instance `ScrollableControl1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=nameWithType> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#74](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#74)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#74](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#74)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks You would typically use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollEventArgs.ScrollOrientation%2A> property to determine the scroll bar orientation that raised the `Scroll` event, such as with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=nameWithType> event.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=nameWithType> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl>. Then name the instance `ScrollableControl1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.Scroll?displayProperty=nameWithType> event.
